title: Big bloc, strong words: SCO flexes global influence as US bristles; what is India's role?
content: Leaders from the Shanghai Cooperation Organization's ten member states, including India, Russia, and China, are convening in northern China. The SCO, seen as an alternative to US-led approaches, encompasses 40% of the world's population.

title: SCO Summit: Xi presents 4-point plan to upgrade India-China ties - how PM Modi responded
content: President Xi Jinping proposed suggestions for a healthy China-India relationship, emphasizing that the border issue shouldn't define the overall bilateral ties. However, PM Modi stressed that the boundary situation impacts relations, highlighting the need for border peace. Both leaders acknowledged the importance of their relationship for global stability, with discussions also involving future cooperation.

title: 'Country would be completely destroyed': Trump defends tariffs after US court setback
content: Donald Trump defended his trade policy after a court declared most of his tariffs illegal. He thanked a judge who sided with him. Trump claimed tariffs brought trillions of dollars to the US. A court ruled Trump overstepped his authority with the tariffs. The levies were set to cover about 69 percent of US imports.

title: E20 ethanol-blended petrol hits vehicle mileage, users bear brunt
content: Consumers are facing a double blow as ethanol-blended petrol (E20), despite its higher price, reduces vehicle mileage by 2-6%. Delhi-based engineer Surender Pal Singh experienced a significant drop in his car's mileage, prompting concerns shared by other users on social media.

title: More flash floods, landslides? India set for wetter Sept; what's causing record rainfall?
content: India is expected to receive above-normal rainfall in September, exacerbating the already extreme monsoon season. The IMD warns of potential disruptions like landslides and floods, particularly in Uttarakhand and other regions. Northwest and South Peninsular India have already experienced unusually heavy rainfall, leading to devastating floods and landslides in several states.

title: Parenting choice: Gates on picking daughter’s school; small choice, big impact
content: Melinda French Gates revealed that Bill Gates, despite his demanding role as Microsoft CEO, made time to drive their eldest daughter to preschool daily. This decision, initially a family negotiation, surprisingly inspired other parents to share domestic responsibilities more equitably. The car rides became cherished moments for Bill and his children, highlighting the importance of balancing work and family.

title: ‘Tribals exempt from UCC’: Rijiju clarifies govt stand
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju assured that tribals in the northeast and other regions would be exempt from the proposed Uniform Civil Code, allowing them to maintain their social systems. Speaking at an event, Rijiju highlighted the government's commitment to UCC while respecting tribal autonomy.

title: 'Two-way force': Thompson praises teammate Davis; calls him 'best power forward of his gen'
content: Dallas Mavericks guard Klay Thompson believes Anthony Davis is the best power forward. Thompson is excited about the team's frontcourt potential for the 2025-2026 season. He praised Davis's skills and the team's depth. Davis's health is crucial for Dallas's Western Conference hopes. The Mavericks acquired Davis from the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: White House on Musk’s Grok: Recovers from Hitler row; urges xAI return
content: The White House has reportedly directed the General Services Administration (GSA) to expedite the addition of Elon Musk's xAI and its Grok chatbot to the list of approved vendors for government use. This directive follows a previously scuttled partnership due to Grok's controversial antisemitic content generation.

title: US tariffs: India moves to protect exporters; what steps are being planned
content: In response to the US tariff hike, the government is preparing measures to protect industries and workers, focusing on employment-heavy sectors. Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur expressed confidence in achieving the fiscal deficit target, citing strong macroeconomic fundamentals, robust capex, and broad-based economic expansion reflected in the 7.8% growth in the April-June quarter.

title: DeSantis slams H-1B: US anti-immigrant rhetoric rises; Indians to bear the brunt
content: Growing hostility towards the H-1B visa program in the U.S. is evolving into a politically charged attack, threatening Indian professionals' livelihoods. Rhetoric from figures like Governor DeSantis and others frames Indian workers as threats, fueling anti-immigrant sentiment and discriminatory practices. This environment creates uncertainty for Indian students and professionals seeking opportunities in the U.S. technology sector.

title: Clash in Paris results: Roman Reigns wins big; stretchered out after brutal Bronson Reed match
content: WWE Clash in Paris 2025 witnessed Roman Reigns defeating Bronson Reed in a brutal opening match. Post-victory, Reigns attacked Paul Heyman, but Bron Breakker ambushed Reigns with spears, leading to a vicious assault by Reed, who delivered multiple Tsunamis while Reigns was tied up. Jey Uso attempted a save but also fell victim to the duo's onslaught.

title: AI tie-ups: Google CEO, Meta’s Zuckerberg; Partner with Reliance on Superintelligence
content: At Reliance's AGM, Sundar Pichai and Mark Zuckerberg highlighted partnerships with Reliance to propel India into an AI-powered era. Zuckerberg envisions delivering personal superintelligence to every Indian through open-source AI models. Pichai announced a Google Cloud region in Jamnagar, dedicated to Reliance, to support AI adoption across Indian businesses and industries.

title: PM Modi, Xi discussed Pak's cross-border terror; MEA says China offered cooperation
content: During a meeting at the SCO summit in Tianjin, Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping addressed cross-border terrorism, recognizing its impact on both India and China. PM Modi emphasized the necessity of mutual understanding and support in combating this shared threat. He also highlighted the importance of peace along the border for fostering India-China relations based on trust and respect.

title: ‘There was a blast from within': Fire guts Hindu community centre in London; probe on
content: A devastating fire engulfed the Shree Sorathia Prajapati Community Centre in Ilford, east London, on Saturday night, completely destroying the building. Fortunately, no one was injured as devotees were participating in a Ganesh Chaturthi procession when the fire erupted. Authorities are investigating the cause, but preliminary information suggests it was not intentional.

title: 'So what I took the hat': Rich Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek now threatens online trolls
content: Millionaire CEO Piotr Szczerek, infamous for snatching a signed hat from a child at the US Open, allegedly defended his actions in a statement, claiming "first come, first served." He also threatened legal action against online critics. "I understand that some people might not like it, but please, let's not make a global scandal out of the hat. It's just a hat. If yoy were faster, you would have it," he reportedly said on a Goworkd forum.

title: Hailee Steinfeld on-set stress: 'I feel like I know nothing' — Josh Allen’s wife opens up
content: BAFTA-nominated actress Hailee Steinfeld, known for roles in 'True Grit' and 'Sinners', recently shared her feelings about starting new projects, admitting to experiencing first-day nerves despite her extensive experience. Steinfeld, who values privacy, maintained a low profile with Buffalo Bills' star Josh Allen until their engagement in November 2024.

title: Luka Doncic makes history in EuroBasket 2025 as teammate Edo Muric hails the NBA pro
content: Luka Doncic achieved a triple-double, leading Slovenia to victory against Belgium in EuroBasket. He became the fourth player to achieve this feat. Edo Muric praised Doncic's relentless desire to win. Muric highlighted Doncic's competitive spirit in all aspects of life. Slovenia secured their first victory in EuroBasket. Coach Aleksander Sekulic emphasized Doncic's focused mindset.

title: Dana White’s $50K transplant donation sparks comparison with Dwayne Johnson & MrBeast
content: UFC President Dana White made a quiet donation in 2010. He gave $50,000 to save a Thai girl's life. The girl needed urgent liver surgery. Ben Pittsley shared the story on social media. White's act contrasts with public charity. Fans appreciate his private kindness. He also supported Ben Askren's transplant.

title: 'Hold Bihar SIR again': Congress says EC rejected 89 lakhs complaints
content: Pawan Khera alleged that the Election Commission dismissed approximately 89 lakh complaints of irregularities raised by Congress's Booth Level Agents during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Khera questioned the EC's intentions, claiming that BLAs' complaints were rejected with the directive that only individual complaints would be accepted, not those from political parties.

title: Clemens’s immediate Hall of Fame induction! Trump cited Pete Rose case, why?
content: Donald Trump has publicly advocated for Roger Clemens' Hall of Fame induction, drawing parallels to Pete Rose's situation. Clemens, despite his stellar career, faced Hall of Fame challenges due to steroid allegations and failed to garner enough votes during his ten years on the Baseball Writers' Association of America ballot.

title: SCO Summit: Bilateral with Putin, plenary address - PM Modi's agenda on Day 2
content: Prime Minister Modi's visit to Tianjin for the SCO Summit marked his first trip to China in over seven years, following a visit to Japan. Discussions with President Xi Jinping emphasized a partnership approach, focusing on trade expansion and dispute resolution. Modi also met with President Putin, while the summit addressed trade tensions and included leaders from over 20 nations.

title: 'Nothing is more disgusting than a child bully': Who is Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek?
content: Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, faced immense backlash after a video surfaced showing him snatching a signed hat from a child at the US Open. Social media users identified Szczerek and his company, leading to a flood of negative reviews and criticism. Tennis star Kamil Majchrzak who signed the hat responded to the row and tracked down the child, Brok, and gifted him a new signed cap and other memorabilia.

title: Abu Obeida killed: Israel eliminates Hamas spokesperson, confirms Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that the military targeted Abu Obeida, the spokesman of Hamas’s armed wing. This announcement comes amidst Israel’s ongoing war in Gaza, during which it has eliminated key Hamas figures. Hamas confirmed the death of Mohammed Sinwar, believed to be its leader in Gaza, adding another layer to the conflict's complexities.

title: Bengaluru school fee shock: Rs 7.35L for Grade 1; Rs 11L for Class 12
content: A Bengaluru international school's ₹7.35 lakh annual fee for Grade 1 has ignited a debate on affordability and access to quality education. The viral fee structure sparked outrage, with many questioning if even high-income families can afford such costs. This controversy highlights the growing disparity in education expenses, raising concerns about whether quality education is becoming a luxury in India.

title: From orphan to 150 caps: Pathak makes history for India at Asia Cup
content: Krishan Bahadur Pathak, the Indian men's hockey goalkeeper, celebrated his 150th international cap during the Hero Men’s Asia Cup 2025 match against Japan. Overcoming immense personal adversity, including being orphaned at a young age, Pathak has become a mainstay in the Indian team since his debut in 2018.

title: Shedeur Sanders' message to Deion Sanders: Proves Sanders legacy of resilience
content: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.

title: Eagles’ 2025 Rookies: PFF rankings erupt; instant NFL impact shakes preseason
content: Philadelphia's 2025 rookie class is already turning heads, with Willie Lampkin, Antwaun Powell-Ryland, and Andrew Mukuba earning spots on PFF's Preseason All-Rookie Team. Lampkin's potential on the offensive line, Powell-Ryland's pass-rushing prowess, and Mukuba's impactful plays in the secondary showcase the Eagles' focus on developing young talent. These rookies signal a promising future for Philadelphia.

title: 'India not schoolkid': US journalist slams Trump's Russia oil tariffs
content: American journalist Rick Sanchez of Russia Today has criticized the US for imposing secondary tariffs on India over Russian oil, calling it disrespectful and ignorant. He highlighted India's autonomy in choosing oil suppliers as a transformational moment, noting India's significance on the global stage.

title: Big blow! Sarfaraz Khan ruled out of action for three weeks with injury
content: Sarfaraz Khan's hopes for the upcoming Test season have been dashed as a quadriceps injury sustained during the Buchi Babu Tournament has ruled him out of the Duleep Trophy. Dhruv Jurel is also sidelined with a groin injury, while Tilak Varma will miss the tournament due to Asia Cup duty, resulting in Azharuddeen leading South Zone.

title: White House denies entry to actor Dyan Cannon; what did she lie about?
content: Dyan Cannon, 88, faced an unexpected White House lockout due to a discrepancy in her passport age. Accompanied by fellow actresses and a chef for their podcast, 'God's Table,' Cannon's past age fib caused a delay. Despite the hiccup, Cannon humorously embraced the situation, reaffirming that age is just a number.

title: Pak's Punjab faces biggest flood in history: 33 killed, 7 lakh evacuated
content: Severe flooding in Pakistan's Punjab province, exacerbated by global warming, has impacted two million people, marking the region's biggest flood in history. Heavy monsoon rains have caused three rivers to reach unprecedented water levels, leading to widespread evacuations and significant damage.

title: Hockey Asia Cup: Harmanpreet scores twice; India beat Japan 3-2
content: Captain Harmanpreet Singh scored twice as India edged Japan 3-2 in their second Pool A match of the men’s Asia Cup. Mandeep Singh added an early goal for India, while Kosei Kawabe netted twice for Japan. India had opened their campaign with a 4-3 win over China and will face Kazakhstan next, with the winner earning a World Cup spot.

title: Touching tribute! PM Modi to retired Pujara: 'Team's fate was in safe hands'
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, after retiring from all cricket forms, received a heartfelt appreciation letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cricket. Modi lauded Pujara's resilience, temperament, and pivotal role in Test cricket, especially his remarkable performances in challenging overseas conditions.

title: Daylight murder in Bengal: 19-yr-old shot twice by boyfriend in front of family
content: In Krishnanagar, a 19-year-old girl, Isha Mallik, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend, Debraj Singha, at her home on Monday afternoon. The police reported that the victim was shot twice at point-blank range after she decided to end their relationship. The accused is currently absconding, and a manhunt has been initiated by the police to apprehend him.

title: 'We don't eat beef': Salim Khan on family's food choices
content: Salim Khan revealed his family's long-held tradition of abstaining from beef, rooted in Prophet Mohammed's teachings emphasizing the cow's importance. He highlighted the seamless integration of Hindu traditions in his life, predating his marriage to Salma Khan.

title: 'Was saving money for wedding': Indian-origin truck driver dies in Autralia road crash
content: Jagseer Boparai, a 37-year-old Indian-origin man, tragically died in a car accident in Salisbury, Australia. He lost control of his car, colliding with a tree, bus shelter, and power pole. The accident occurred just weeks before his planned return to India for his wedding, devastating his family and the local community.

title: India-China ties: PM Modi stresses 'strategic autonomy'; message for Trump?
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping, during the SCO Summit in Tianjin, affirmed India and China as development partners, not rivals, emphasising the need to prevent differences from escalating into disputes. They acknowledged their crucial role in stabilising global trade amid US tariffs and discussed expanding bilateral trade, investment and reducing the trade deficit. PM Modi invited Xi to the BRICS summit in India in 2026, highlighting strengthened bilateral relations.

title: MS Dhoni as Team India mentor? Ex-cricketer takes a dig, says 'woh phone uthaye hain na?'
content: Reports suggest the BCCI has approached MS Dhoni to mentor the Indian team for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Manoj Tiwary humorously commented on Dhoni's elusiveness, questioning his availability. Tiwary also highlighted the potential benefits of Dhoni's experience and the intriguing prospect of him working alongside Gautam Gambhir, while emphasizing that Dhoni's acceptance of the role remains uncertain.

title: India’s AI demand surges: 10 roles, 1 engineer; skills crisis explained
content: India's booming AI industry faces a critical talent shortage, with only one qualified engineer available for every ten Generative AI job openings. This scarcity drives salaries sky-high, particularly in AI, cloud computing, and cybersecurity. Tier-2 cities are emerging as tech hubs, fostering greater inclusion and offering new opportunities, but urgent upskilling is needed to sustain India's digital growth.

title: Bihar CEO dismisses allegations of duplicate voters in draft rolls
content: The Bihar CEO refuted media reports of widespread duplication in the draft electoral rolls (SIR 2025), deeming the claims premature and speculative. He clarified that the draft rolls are open for public scrutiny, inviting objections and verification.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann seeks Rs 60K cr from Centre; schools closed
content: Punjab is grappling with severe flooding, prompting Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to request Prime Minister Modi to release Rs 60,000 crore in pending state funds. The floods, triggered by heavy rains and dam water releases, have devastated seven districts, submerging farmland and impacting livelihoods. The state government has extended school closures and seeks revised disaster relief compensation norms for farmers.

title: 53-year-old man kills 10-year-old girl after failed rape attempt; held
content: In Firozabad, a 53-year-old man was arrested for the murder of a 10-year-old girl. The accused lured the Class 2 student into a millet field with the intention of sexual assault. When he failed in his attempt, he strangled her with a rope and hid her body, fearing she would reveal his crime.

title: Sources: Cowboys, Bland reach $92M extension
content: The Cowboys and cornerback DaRon Bland have agreed to a four-year extension worth $92 million, sources told ESPN's Todd Archer.

title: Source: Phillies add ex-Red Sox pitcher Buehler
content: The Phillies have reached agreement on a contract with veteran right-hander Walker Buehler, a source told ESPN's Buster Olney on Sunday.

title: Angels' Ward crashes into scoreboard, carted off
content: Angels outfielder Taylor Ward was carted off the field after crashing face first into the metal scoreboard in left field while trying to make a catch against the Astros.

title: Back in Black: Beamer supports son over Hokies
content: Former Virginia Tech coach Frank Beamer showed up for the Hokies' opener against South Carolina, which is coached by son Shane Beamer, wearing black to support the Gamecocks.

title: Charlie Woods makes ace during Junior Players
content: Charlie Woods made an ace on the third hole at TPC Sawgrass in the final round of the Junior Players Championship.

title: Alcaraz goes behind-the-back en route to quarters
content: No. 2 seed Carlos Alcaraz earned a straightforward 7-6 (3), 6-3, 6-4 win over Arthur Rinderknech on Sunday -- which featured a behind-the-back shot -- to reach his 13th major quarterfinal.

title: Szoboszlai stunner sees Liverpool edge Arsenal
content: Liverpool earned a crucial three points during the early stages of the title race as Szoboszlai's stunning free kick secured a victory over Arsenal.

title: Pegula rides 'encouraging' win to US Open quarters
content: No. 4 seed Jessica Pegula, the 2024 US Open runner-up, advanced to the quarterfinals at Flushing Meadows for a second straight year with a 6-1, 6-2 win over fellow American Ann Li on Sunday.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football PPR rankings for Week 1
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Making of a 'Jeremonstar': Notre Dame's Jeremiyah Love shares his story through passion for comics
content: Working on an anime-style comic book has been a cathartic experience for Notre Dame's star running back.

title: Week 1 showed us what we got right and wrong this offseason -- and we got plenty wrong
content: We might not be through the opening scenes, but we've already upended the Heisman race and slayed a giant.

title: The VAR Review: Fulham fume at disallowed goal while Man United get late penalty
content: Fulham were furious when Josh King's goal was ruled out at Chelsea, while Manchester United's late victory over Burnley came courtesy of a VAR penalty.

title: Clay makes his NFL season forecast: Picking the best offenses, top defenses and Super Bowl winner
content: Let's project the NFL's best -- and worst -- offenses and defenses. Plus, how do all 32 teams rank overall, and who will make the Super Bowl?

title: Guide to the rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebration﻿
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: WWE Clash in Paris: Live results and analysis
content: Seth Rollins puts the World Heavyweight Championship on the line against Jey Uso, CM Punk, and LA Knight, while John Cena takes on Logan Paul at WWE Clash in Paris.

title: Norris' Dutch GP DNF makes the 2025 F1 title Piastri's to lose
content: Lando Norris' DNF at Sunday's Dutch GP may well be the decisive moment of the 2025 F1 season, when the title became Oscar Piastri's to lose.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a championship-winning manager.

title: How Liam Coen is trying to set Trevor Lawrence and Travis Hunter up for success
content: Coen has worked with Lawrence on fundamentals this offseason while curating a plan to utilize two-way threat Hunter.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern's Lookman offer rejected, Spurs linked
content: Tottenham could make a late move for Atalanta forward Ademola Lookman after Bayern had an offer rebuffed. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: FSU's Tommy Castellanos trolls Alabama, sells 'Nick Can't Save Them' shirts
content: Castellanos made headlines after saying that the legendary Alabama head coach couldn't save the Crimson Tide from their Week 1 matchup.

title: Chasing history: Can Derrick Henry run past seven Hall of Famers to reach top 10 all time?
content: The Baltimore Ravens running back sits at No. 19 on the rushing list and has a chance to bypass seven Hall of Famers.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Shortage of trains, high bus fares disrupt Keralites’ travel plans
content: Passengers demand more special trains and KSRTC inter-State buses, to destinations like Bengaluru and Chennai, during the festival season

title: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge meets Poland’s Deputy Prime Minister to strengthen technological ties
content: Karnataka’s Minister for Rural Development & Panchayat Raj and Information Technology Priyank Kharge met Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Digital Affairs of Poland Krzysztof Gawkowski, during his official visit to Poland

title: Police, excise step up vigil to curb flow of drugs, liquor
content: Searches are being carried out at railway stations in the city and suburbs in view of the Onam season; Excise dept. readies two units of ‘striking force’ to deal with emergency situations

title: India Post suspends mail operations to U.S. in absence of rule clarity
content: The Department of Posts says it is closely monitoring the situation and making every effort to restore services at the earliest

title: Issue GR on Maratha quota on available records, says Jarange
content: “We won’t budge from the protest venue till demands are met even if the Fadnavis government fires bullets at us,” Mr. Jarange said

title: Nagaland Assembly to discuss influence of ‘devil worship’
content: Naga People’s Front MLA Küzholuzo Nienü sought a special session to discuss impact of Devil worship on the youth in the Christian-majority State

title: India and China are victims of terrorism, PM Modi tells Xi, in a shift from recent positions
content: PM raised issue of Pahalgam attack during bilateral meeting, called for China’s support, says Foreign Secretary; side-steps query on China’s support to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor

title: Centre deputes teams to assess damage in disaster-hit States
content: Inter-Ministerial Central Teams to visit Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab and J&K; relief works under review

title: Trinamool leaders, kin in list of tainted teachers published by WBSSC
content: BJP and CPI(M) leaders say these names proved the complicity of the higher-ups in the teacher recruitment scam

title: Chief Minister, Harish Rao engage in wordy duels over Kaleshwaram Project, Ghose Commission of Inquiry Report
content: The exchanges mainly centred around availability of water at Tummidihatti and Medigadda locations, the reasons behind re-engineering and re-designing of projects

title: Bihar Assembly polls: NDA will cross 200 seats; INDIA bloc to fall below 40, says Nityanand Rai
content: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs alleges ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’ was held to mislead people and shelter “infiltrators”

title: Metro connectivity changes Kolkata’s commute
content: Three new stretches of the Kolkata Metro Railway, which became operational in the last week of August 2025, have brought relief to passengers of the bustling metropolis. Moyurie Som takes stock of what the new network brings to West Bengal’s capital, and whether the authorities are prepared to meet the challenges that come with it

title: SCCL unions demand improved measures for safety at 49th Safety Tripartite Review Meeting
content: The SCCL has already set an example in coal production, and it is equally the responsibility of all to shape it into an accident-free company, Singareni CMD said

title: "Issue Reservation On Maratha Quota On Available Records": Activist Jarange
content: Activist Manoj Jarange on Sunday asked the Devendra Fadnavis dispensation to issue a government resolution (GR) on Maratha reservations based on available records.

title: As Bihar Poll Revision Deadline Nears, Over 2 Lakh Seek Removal Of Names
content: The month-long period to demand inclusion or deletion of names from the electoral rolls of Bihar ends on Monday, with more than 33,000 electors filing pleas to add their names to the list.

title: "Crucial Evidence" Recovered In Dharmasthala Case Investigation
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT), which has arrested the complainant in the Dharmasthala multiple murders, rapes and burials case, has recovered "crucial evidence" when they escorted him to Bengaluru as part of the investigation, official sources

title: Woman Activist Who Entered Sabarimala Won't Be Invited To Ayyappa Minister
content: Kerala Devaswom Minister V N Vasavan on Sunday made it clear that Bindu Ammini, one of the women activists who entered into the Sabarimala Ayyappa Temple in 2019, will not be invited to take part in the upcoming Global Ayyappa Sangamam.

title: J&K Government Orders Audit Of School Buildings Across Jammu
content: Authorities on Sunday ordered a safety audit of all school buildingsacross Jammu division, which has been battered by heavy rains and flash floods over the past week, even as the closure of schools in the region was extended till Monday.

title: Nitish Kumar Lacks Vision, NDA Will Be Unseated In Bihar: Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav alleged that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar "lacked" vision, asserting that the NDA government in the state will be unseated from power in the upcoming assembly polls.

title: "Tribals To Be Kept Out Of Ambit Of Proposed UCC": Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Sunday said tribals of the northeast and other areas of the country will be kept out of the ambit of the proposed Uniform Civil Code so that they can live their lives "freely" as per their systems.

title: Rahul Gandhi Moves High Court Against Varanasi Court On Sikh Remarks
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has approached the Allahabad High Court against an order of a special MP-MLA court of Varanasi that had directed a subordinate court to hear afresh an application seeking registration of an FIR against him.

title: "Friendship, Trade, Cultural Linkages": PM Modi Meets World Leaders At SCO Reception
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday attended the official reception for Heads of State and Heads of Government at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Tianjin, China, where he met with several world leaders and dignitaries.

title: Thane Woman Dies By Suicide During Video Call With Boyfriend: Police
content: A 23-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide during a video call with her boyfriend in Maharashtra's Thane district, prompting his detention after accusations of harassment and blackmail, a police source said on Sunday.

title: Dharmasthala Case: "Don't Think There Is Need For NIA Probe," Says Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said there is no need for NIA probe into allegations of multiple rapes, murders and burials in Dharmasthala over past two decades, and that the SIT has been given complete freedom to investigate and submit a report

title: Government, Opposition Clash In Telangana Assembly Over Kaleshwaram Project
content: The Telangana Legislative Assembly convened for its second day, with the proceedings dominated by a heated debate over the Justice PC Ghose Commission report on the Kaleshwaram irrigation project.

title: Family Tragedy Brings Together Allu Arjun, Pawan Kalyan
content: A video and photos showing Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and actor Pawan Kalyan visiting actor Allu Arjun at his home in Hyderabad, has gone viral, sparking widespread discussion across social media platforms.

title: "The Impossible Is Possible": Axiom CEO On Building India's Space Future
content: The International Space Station, a multi-billion-dollar floating space laboratory visited by astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, is slated for retirement by 2030, and Axiom Space is already building its replacement.

title: Stepmother Beats 8-Year-Old To Death Using Tongs, Rolling Pin In UP; Arrested: Cops
content: An eight-year-old boy was allegedly beaten to death by his stepmother with a pair of tongs and a rolling pin, police said on Sunday.

title: Siddaramaiah Calls Dasara 'Secular', Defends Invite To Banu Mushtaq
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Sunday defended the decision to invite International Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate this year's Mysuru Dasara, describing the event as a "secular" and "cultural" festival for all communities.

title: Israel Kills Hamas Spokesperson Amid Expanding Gaza Offensive Discussion
content: The Israeli military announced Sunday that it killed the longtime spokesperson for Hamas' armed wing, as the country's security cabinet met to discuss the expanding offensive in some of Gaza's most populated areas.

title: PM Modi China Visit Live Updates: PM Modi, Xi Jinping Hold Talks On Peace At Borders, Fighting Terror
content: PM Modi China Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was formally received by Chinese President Xi Jinping at the SCO Summit.

title: PM Modi Raises Pak Cross-Border Terror With China, Xi Extends Support To India
content: China has extended support in fighting terror to India during the bilateral summit between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping, the foreign ministry said today.

title: PM, Xi Boost India-China Ties With Direct Flights, Trade, Optics: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Tianjin is a step forward towards improving the relations between the two countries, as well as strong optics in the wake of Washington's hefty tariffs.

title: Mamkootathil finds powerful voices of support in Congress, signalling possible end to political isolation
content: UDF convener Adoor Prakash terms the sexual misconduct charges against Mamkoothatil ‘unsubstantiated’ and says that the Palakkad MLA will attend the Assembly session that commences on September 15

title: Researchers identify new tuber species from Western Ghats in Kerala’s Wayanad district
content: The newly identified species has been named Dioscorea balakrishnanii after V. Balakrishnan, environmentalist and current secretary of the Kerala State Biodiversity Board

title: Works on Anakkampoyil-Meppadi tunnel road get under way
content: Project, which will offer an alternative to the Thamarassery Ghat road, expected to be completed in 60 months. The road connects Thiruvambady panchayat in Kozhikode district to Meppadi panchayat in Wayanad district

title: Ghose Commission finds former Chief Minister KCR accountable for lapses in Kaleshwaram Barrages: Uttam in Assembly
content: He says Commission pointed out that due procedures were not followed in various stage of execution of barrages, their operations and maintenance

title: Dharmasthala: Nikhil Kumaraswamy demands probe by Central agency
content: Claiming that the ‘Satya Yatra’ taken up by the Janata Dal (Secular) was meant to protect dharma and not politically motivated, JDS) youth wing leader Nikhil Kumaraswamy on Sunday said there has been a conspiracy against Dharmasthala, which has to be investigated by a Central agency

title: DKS hails Mysuru kings and Urs community for building ‘secular and irreligious’ Karnataka
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar on Sunday hailed the contribution of Mysuru kings and the Urs community towards building a secular and irreligious Karnataka with a focus on human development

title: Compensation for crop loss, house damage in rain as per rules, says Minister
content: Deputy Commissioner instructs Dharwad officials to submit final consolidated report of joint survey by Monday evening

title: Kerala achieves top rankings in UDISE+ for 2024-25, says Sivankutty
content: Kerala’s achievement of 99.5% retention rate, indicating the fact that 99.5% out of every 100 students who enter Class I reach Class X, is significant especially when compared with the national average and the record of the other States, says Minister

title: Death threat video: Nellore Rural MLA accuses YSRCP of hatching plan to kill him
content: Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy says not me, even my six-year-old grandson will not be cowed down by such threats; however, YSRCP ridicules the MLA’s accusations and rubbishes the act as a ‘political stunt’

title: Panel recommends inclusion of 28 OBCs on Socially and Educationally Backward Classes list for educational benefits
content: Those on the OBC list are eligible for reservation in government jobs, but students need to be on the SEBC list for accessing educational concessions such as scholarships and reservation in admissions.

title: Ashok lashes out at Congress, threatens Chamundeshwari chalo agitation
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok threatened to launch a Chamundeshwari chalo rally on the lines of the Dharmasthala one and lashed out at the Congress for “hurting the sentiments of Hindus”

title: Bishop Valloppilly Memorial Museum opens after phase one work
content: The State Archaeology department spent ₹36 lakh on construction, while the government granted ₹1.6 crore in 2021

title: Reduce minimum age to contest Assembly polls to 21, says Telangana CM
content: Youngsters, after clearing the civil service examination, govern districts and handle administrative responsibilities. Then why should they not be allowed to contest Assembly elections at 21? Revanth Reddy asks

title: More than 33,000 people apply for re-inclusion in Bihar electoral rolls
content: Over 15 lakh applications from new electors and over 2 lakh objections filed against names in draft list; no information from ECI in response to RTI queries on the basis for SIR 2025, and details of the 2003 intensive revision

title: K-Stores will accept passport applications, says Minister
content: Services typically offered by Akshaya centres and common service centres will also be made available at the upgraded ration shops

title: With tailwind from ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’, Congress to seek a better seat-sharing deal in Bihar
content: The yatra has given the Congress a platform to reassert its relevance, but its success will depend on translating public enthusiasm into electoral gains by strengthening the party’s organisation and crafting a sharper economic message

title: New underpass near CMC campus in Ranipet to be ready by December
content: The NHAI, which is executing the work, says the Rs 22-crore-subway is being built at Puttuthakku village

title: Godavari flood: 30 tribal villages cut off in Polavaram submergence area in Chintoor agency
content: First Godavari flood warning in force at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage; inflow above 11.35 lakh cusecs and 12,200 cusecs of floodwater being released into the Godavari delta

title: KC(M) to push harder for seats in LDF ahead of local body polls
content: Party leaders express confidence that a strong showing in the local body elections will pave the way for excellent results in Assembly elections

title: Rahul Gandhi moves High Court against Varanasi court order on alleged objectionable remarks
content: Congress leader challenges court order in Allahabad High Court on FIR registration for Sikh statement made during a 2024 U.S. visit

title: Congress filed 89 lakh complaints on Bihar SIR with the ECI, but all were rejected, says Pawan Khera
content: Alleging that the irregularities cast a doubt on the intention of the Election Commission of India, Mr. Khera demanded that the entire exercise be conducted again.

title: PLL semifinals preview: Stats, matchups, how to watch
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs continue this weekend on ESPN . the four teams travel to Subaru Park outside of Philadelphia for the semifinals . sports analyst Quint Kessenich revealed his keys to both matches . he will move ahead of casey Powel with four points .

title: Szoboszlai, Liverpool make statement start to 2025-26 in win over Arsenal
content: Dominik Szoboszlai scores one of the greatest free kicks in premier league history . the german beat arsenal keeper David Raya from 30 yards with a powerful right-footed strike in the 83rd minute . arsenal had controlled the game without being able to create clear chances .

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?
content: nneka Ogwumike's clutch bucket at the buzzer gives the Storm an 84-82 win over the Mystics . sports experts contend there's no such thing as a consistent clutch player in any sport . who are the biggest clutch shooters in the WNBA, when a game is on the line .

title: A's monitor Kurtz; Chourio returns for Brewers with homer

title: What we're hearing before transfer deadline day: Liverpool to return for Isak?

title: Who has a shot at the championship? Projecting conference and Finals winners
content: this season, the Oklahoma City Thunder will look to become the first back-to-back champions since 2018 . but there will be plenty of challengers . the new york Knicks have plenty of postseason experience to push even fury .

title: Why the Cowboys love spring football -- and how it pays off in the fall
content: the Dallas Cowboys signed wide receiver/return specialist KaVontae Turpin in 2022 . they have combined for four pro Bowl appearances -- two apiece -- and are considered one of the best, if not the best . the cowboys hope he can be the third success story from spring football .
